This endpoint is titled "Customer - Square - Create ++". It's a POST method used to create a new customer profile for Square payment services. The served URL is "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/create". The following data must be provided as a part of the request body in JSON format:

- `accountId`: This field is meant for the account ID of the customer that's to be created. Replace the placeholder "accountId" with the actual account ID value.
  
- `sessionId`: This field is designed for the session ID during which the customer profile is being created. Replace the placeholder "sessionId" with the actual session ID.

- `source`: This portion is a composite of different essential data about the customer:
    - `firstName`: Customer's first name.
    - `lastName`: Customer's last name.
    - `zipcode`: Zipcode of the customer's address.
    - `country`: Customer's country of residence.
    - `state`: State in which the customer resides.
    - `city`: City in which the customer resides.
    - `address`: Full address of the customer.
    - `email`: Email address of the customer.
    - `phone`: Phone number of the customer. It should be provided in international format.

- `isSaveCustomer`: It's a boolean (true/false) flag. When set to true, it indicates that the customer profile should be saved.

- `isPrimary`: Another boolean flag. When set to true, it signifies that the newly created profile should be regarded as the primary customer profile.

- `provider`: The name of the payment provider. In this endpoint, it is "square".

Note: All headers are empty in this request. The body mode is raw, and the language set for this raw mode is JSON.

This endpoint is named "Customer - Square - Update". The purpose of this API call is to update the details of an existing customer in the Square payment service. 

Request Details:
1. Request Method: PUT. The PUT method is used to update resource information.
2. URL: The endpoint URL is "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/update".

Headers: The request does not require any specific header information.

Request Body: The request requires the following fields in the body:

1. `accountId`: This should be string containing the account identifier.
2. `sessionId`: This should be string containing the unique session identifier.
3. `customerId`: This should be string that represents the square customer id.
   
   A `source` object has to be passed containing:
    - `firstName`: String to specify the first name of the customer.
    - `lastName`: String to specify the last name of the customer.
    - `zipcode`: String containing the zip code of the customer's location.
    - `country`: String representing the country of the customer's location. Here it is set to "US".
    - `state`: String representing the state of the customer's location. Here it is set to "CA".
    - `city`:  String representing the city of the customer's location. Here it is set to "Oakland".
    - `address`: String containing the customer's address.
    - `email`: String containing the customer's email.
    - `phone`: String with the customer's phone number.
   
4. `isSaveRecurring`: Boolean value to set the flag for saving recurring transactions. If true, recurring transactions will be saved.
5. `isPrimary`: Boolean value to indicate whether this updated customer should be considered as a primary customer. If property set as true, this customer will be set as primary.
6. `provider`: This is string specifying the payment service provider. In this case, it's set to "square".

Request Body Options:

- `raw`: This option is set with a language value of "json". This indicates the request body sent will be a raw JSON object.
  
This data must be filled out accurately to update the corresponding customer details correctly.

This is the 'Customer - Square - Get' API endpoint. The following is a description of each data that the endpoint uses:

1. "name": This indicates the name of the API endpoint. In this case, the name is 'Customer - Square - Get'. This suggests that this endpoint is used to retrieve information about a customer from the payment provider 'Square'.

2. "request": This encompasses the details of the request being made to the API. 

    a. "method": Specifies the HTTP method used for the API request. In this case, 'GET' is used, which is generally used to retrieve or read data from a server.

    b. "url": This is the URL where the request will be sent. This endpoint is on 'localhost' using port '3000' and specific path '/api/payment/customer/get/'. This means the request is sent to your local server on the port number 3000. This particular API functionality serves to get the customer data from the payment provider.

    c. Query parameters: There are four query parameters in the given URL.

        - "provider": Declares the payment provider's name. In this case, 'square' is the payment provider.

        - "accountId": Specifies the account ID. This is a placeholder and should be replaced with the actual account ID when making the request.
        
        - "sessionId": Specifies the session ID. This is also a placeholder and should be replaced with the actual session ID when making the request.

        - "customerId": Unique identifier for a customer. 'ZQ7HFE4KJ0JBJKPGV1DCCBAA3W' is the placeholder customer ID. This should be replaced with the actual customer ID while making the request.

    d. "headers": This is currently an empty array, implying no additional headers are required to process the API request.
   
Please replace all placeholders with actual values before making the request.

This endpoint is named "Customer - Square - Get All." It's responsible for fetching all customer data associated with a specific payment provider, in this case, 'Square.'

The detailed description of the data is as follows:

- "name": The name is a descriptive title for this endpoint. In this case "Customer - Square - Get All" indicates that this API endpoint retrieves all customers from Square.

- "request": This is an object that contains details about the HTTP request.

- "method": This specifies the HTTP method used to send the request. Here, "GET" method is used which retrieves information from the server.

- "url": This is the complete URL where the request is sent. "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/getAll/?provider=square&accountId=accountId&sessionId=sessionId" in this case. 

- The URL includes query parameters after the question mark (?). It contains three parameters:
  1. "provider": The payment provider associated with the customers to be retrieved. 'square' is the value here.
  2. "accountId": The accountId to which the customers are associated. You need to replace 'accountId' placeholder with actual accountId.
  3. "sessionId": A unique session identifier. Replace 'sessionId' with the actual sessionId when making a request.

- "headers": This is an array that can contain any necessary headers for the HTTP request. In this instance, the array is empty, meaning that there are no additional headers required for the request.

Please remember to replace the values of accountId and sessionId in the URL with actual values before making the request.

This endpoint is named "Customer - Square - Delete". It uses the POST method to send a request to "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/delete". Presumably, it will send a request to delete a customer's account from a payment service provider named "Square". There aren't any specified headers in this request. 

The body of the request contains the following parameters:

1. `'accountId'`: Represents the ID of the account which is performing the action. It will be a unique identifier for the user's account.

2. `'sessionId'`: Represents a unique ID pertaining to a particular session of user interaction. This might be used for authentication or to track specific user actions across multiple requests.

3. `'customerId'`: Reflects the ID of the customer whose data is intended to be deleted. In this present configuration, the customer ID is specifically "CJWQBK09ZM16MSWSFHWJP2NVGR". Your actual customerId may vary.

4. `'provider'`: The name of the payment service provider which is processing the request. In this case, it is "Square". 

The body is sent as raw data in JSON format as defined by the `'mode'` and `'options'` fields.

This endpoint is named "Customer - Checkout - Create ++". It's a POST API call to http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/create, an endpoint that creates a new customer for the checkout process.

The API call has the following data fields in its request body:

- **accountId** 
  This field is required to associate the created customer with a specific user account in the system. The accountId should be a valid identifier in your system.

- **sessionId** 
  Takes the session ID in which the current customer's process is running. Mostly used for security and data isolation per user's session.

- **source** 
  Holds the customer's contact information.
  
  - **email** 
    Customer's email address.
  
  - **name**
    Customer's full name.
    
  - **phone** 
    It's an object that has two properties.
    
      - **country_code** 
        International country code of the customer's contact number.
  
      - **number**
        The customer's contact number without the country code.

  - **metadata**
    Set of additional, optional information related to the customer.
    
    - **coupon_code**
      Discount or promotional code if the customer applied any.
    
    - **partner_id**
      It is used when partner affiliates are involved, you should store their id here.

- **isSaveCustomer**
  A boolean to signify if the customers details should be saved in database for future use. True meaning customer details will be saved, false otherwise.

- **isPrimary**
  A boolean flag to signify if this is the primary customer record. This could be used in conjunction with 'isSaveCustomer': if 'isSaveCustomer' is set to true and 'isPrimary' is also set to true this record could overwrite existing primary records.

- **provider**
  Specifies payment provider system. In this example, it's "checkout".

Lastly, the "options" object shows that the language for the payload raw data entered is of "json" format.

The endpoint "Customer - Checkout - Get" is used to retrieve the payment information related to a customer from our system. This endpoint makes a GET request, indicating that it is meant to retrieve and not modify any data. The endpoint is described as follows:

1. Name: "Customer - Checkout - Get" - This is the name of the endpoint, and it briefly describes the functionality of the endpoint. It suggests that this endpoint is used to get information about the customer's checkout from our API.

2. Request Method: "GET" - This specifies the HTTP method this endpoint uses. GET is used to request data from a specified resource.

3. URL: 

   - "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/get/?" - This is the base URL with the endpoint path attached. "http://localhost:3000" is the base URL which will change depending on the environment (production, development, etc.). "/api/payment/customer/get/?" is the endpoint path which is designed to return a customer's payment information.

   - Parameters:
     
     - "customerId" - This is a required query parameter that represents the unique identifier for the customer in our system. It should be followed by = sign and an actual customer ID.
     
     - "provider" - This query parameter tells the system which payment provider to use; in this case, "checkout".
     
     - "accountId" - This query parameter signifies the unique account ID associated with the user making the request. It should be joined by the = sign and an actual account ID.
     
     - "sessionId" - This query parameter refers to the session ID created at login. It's used for authentication and ensures that the request is being made by a logged-in user. It should be joined with the = sign and an actual session ID.
  
4. Headers - This is an array that carries request headers. Request headers hold metadata (as key-value pairs) for the HTTP request. It's represented as an empty array here, which means no additional headers are being sent with the request. The required headers like content-type, authentication, etc., will be automatically included depending on the API needs.

This endpoint is named "Customer - AuthorizeNet - Create ++" and is used to initiate the process of a new customer creation using AuthorizeNet as the payment provider.

It utilizes the "POST" HTTP method and targets the URL: "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/create". Here is a detailed description of the data it accepts:

1. "accountId": The unique identifier for the Account of the customer. This is a required string.

2. "sessionId": The Session ID associated with the customer's current transaction/event. This too is a required string.

3. "source": This object contains additional identifying information about the customer:
    - "email": This is the email address of the customer. It must be in a valid email format.
    - "description": Provides additional context or information about the customer.
    - "merchantCustomerId": This is a unique identifier provided to the customer by the merchant. 

4. "isSaveRecurring": This is a Boolean parameter that indicates whether or not the new customer creation process should allow for recurring payments. If set to 'true', recurring payments can be set up for this customer.

5. "isPrimary": This is also a Boolean parameter, it's used to denote if the customer account is the primary one. If set to 'true', this makes it the primary customer account.

6. "provider": This specifies the payment provider to be used. Here, it is set as "authorizenet", indicating that the payment processing is done through AuthorizeNet.

Headers are not specified for this endpoint; they could be added as per specific requirements.

The body data should be sent as raw JSON as specified in the "raw" field in the "body" object, with "json" being set as the language option.

Overall, this endpoint is used to create a new customer with the ability to set up a recurring payment in AuthorizeNet, as well as to specify whether it's the primary account.

This PUT request `Customer - AuthorizeNet - Update` updates an existing customer payment information stored in AuthorizeNet. The endpoint for this operation is `http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/update`.

**Data Fields**

- `method`: The HTTP method utilized for this request is PUT indicating that we're updating existing resource.

- `url`: The URL where the request is being sent to.

- `headers`: This field is currently empty. Any request headers that are required should be added here.

- `body`: This contains the data payload of the request.

- `mode`: This describes the format of the data in the body. In this case, 'raw' indicates that we're handling raw data.

- `raw`: This is the raw data payload for the request body, provided as a JSON object.

  - `accountId`: This is the account ID related to the payment record.
  
  - `sessionId`: The session id for the individual session should be provided here.

  - `customerId`: This is the identifier of the customer whose payment information is being updated.

  - `source`: This is an object that contains more details about the customer.
  
    - `email`: The email address of the customer.
    
    - `description`: A description of the customer. For instance, 'Customer profile for John Doe 2' describes a second profile for John Doe.
    
    - `merchantCustomerId`: This is the customer ID used by the merchant system.

  - `isSaveCard`: This indicates if the card would be saved for future reference. If true, the card details will be stored.

  - `isPrimary`: This indicates if this is the primary payment method for this customer.

  - `provider`: This denotes the provider of the payment source. In this case, it is 'authorizenet'.

- `options`: The available option for this request is determining the language for payload data. 'json' has been chosen for this request.

**Note**: Make sure to replace placeholder fields like 'accountId', 'sessionId', and 'customerId' in the raw body with valid identifiers when you are making the request.

This endpoint is named "Customer - AuthorizeNet - Get All". It handles a GET request and is used to fetch all customer details from the AuthorizeNet payment provider.

In the context of this endpoint, the following query parameters are used:

2. "accountId": This query parameter is used to specify the account ID associated with the payment provider. Replace "accountId" with the unique ID of the account you're interested in retrieving customer data for.

3. "sessionId": This query parameter is used to specify a session ID. Replace "sessionId" with a valid session ID. This may be used to track or manage user sessions in the application.

Note that this endpoint does not require additional headers for the execution of the GET request.

This endpoint, named "Customer - AuthorizeNet - Delete", is used to delete existing customer information in the system that uses AuthorizeNet as the payment provider. 

The request method for this endpoint is POST, which means the requester sends data to be processed to a specified resource. The URL for the request is `http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/delete`.

This endpoint does not require any specific headers, meaning no additional parameters are needed when the request is sent. 

The body contains information that the server needs to process the request. In the request body, the transmission mode is indicated as "raw", which means the content is sent in its raw form without any transformations.

Inside the `raw` field is a JSON object containing the below parameters:

 - `accountId`: This is a string field which uniquely identifies the account to which the customer is associated. You need to populate this field with a valid account ID.

- `sessionId`: This is a string field which identifies the current session. You need to fill this field with a valid session ID. 

- `customerId`: It's a string-type unique identifier that is used to specify a particular customer. You need to fill this field with the UUID of the customer you wish to delete. For example "02991e85-ff29-4d1f-b5c4-3d6568967bad".

- `provider`: The provider field refers to the payment gateway used in the account. Since the name of the endpoint suggests that it is intended for AuthorizeNet, you should enter "authorizenet" in this field.

The request body also contains options for the raw data. Here, the `language` key within `options` is set to "json", specifying that the raw data is in JSON format.

Remember to replace the values of `accountId`, `sessionId`, and `customerId` with real values when you make the request.

This endpoint is labeled as "Customer - NowPayments - Create ++". It is designed to create a new customer entry utilizing POST protocol. The URL to call this endpoint is "http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/create". It does not require any specific headers.

The request body must be provided in raw JSON format, and has the following parameters:

- "accountId": This parameter is a string representing the unique identifier of your account. It is required for the server to match the request to an account.
   
- "sessionId": This is unique identifier of the current session, it is a string. It is required to track the activity of a particular session.
  
- "source": This parameter is an object that's required to provide additional information about the source. Specifically, it contains a "name" field, which will be the name of the customer you want to create.

- "isSaveCustomer": It is a boolean field and a flag whether to save the customer data or not. If it's set to true, the server will store the customer's information for future use; if it's set to false, the server will not save it.

- "isPrimary": Another boolean field indicating whether the customer is set as the primary customer or not. If true, this customer will be set as the main one for the account.

- "provider": This is a string that should contain the identifier of the payment provider. In this case, it should be set to "nowpayments".

Please make sure to replace placeholders ("accountId" and "sessionId") with actual values when sending a request.

All of these parameters are required to complete a successful request to the given endpoint. Please note that incorrect or missing data could lead to failed requests or errors.

This endpoint is named "Customer - NowPayments - Get". It's a GET request designed to retrieve payment information for a specific customer from the NowPayments service.

This endpoint is named "Customer - NowPayments - Delete". It uses a POST request method to delete a customer's information in the NowPayments system. The request is sent to the URL: http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/delete.

Here are the details of the data sent in the request body:

1. accountId: This is a unique identifier used to identify the account from which the request is being sent. It should be replaced with a valid account ID in your system before sending the request.

2. sessionId: This is another unique identifier associated with the current payment session. It should be replaced with a valid session ID before the request is sent.

3. customerId: This is a unique identifier for the customer in the NowPayments system. This is the ID of the customer you want to delete. Replace the placeholder "nowCustomerId" with the actual ID of the customer you want to delete.

4. provider: This refers to the name of the payment provider system. In this case, it is set to "nowpayments", which means the request is intended for the NowPayments system.

The body data is sent as raw JSON. To make any changes to the request body, keep in mind that it should follow the JSON format.

There are no specific headers required for this request.

When sending this request, make sure to replace placeholders with actual data. If the request is successful, it will delete the customer's profile from the NowPayments system. For the unsuccessful request, check your data and make sure everything is valid and in the correct format.

body.raw:

This endpoint is named "Customer - PayPal - Create ++". It is a POST request, which is used to create a new PayPal customer. The URL for this endpoint is `http://localhost:3000/api/payment/customer/create`, which is where the application will send the POST request. It does not have specific header parameters.

The request body is a raw, JSON-formatted data. The components of the JSON object are as follows:

- `accountId`: A placeholder for the account identifier.
- `sessionId`: A placeholder for the session identifier.
- `source`: An object containing the following fields:
  - `address`: The customer's address, currently set to null.
  - `balance`: Customer's balance, currently set to 0.
  - `description`: A field for the description of the customer's account, currently set to null.
  - `email`: The customer's email address, currently set to "jennyrosen@example.com".
  - `invoice_settings`: This includes settings for the invoice like `custom_fields`, `default_payment_method`, `footer`, and `rendering_options` which are all currently set to null.
  - `metadata`: A JSON object for additional, custom information that doesn't fit in the previous fields, currently empty.
  - `firstName` and `lastName`: The first name and last name of the customer.
  - `next_invoice_sequence`: The sequence number for the next invoice for this customer. Currently set to 1.
  - `phone`: The customer's phone number, currently set to null.
  - `preferred_locales`: A list of locale codes the customer prefers for communication, currently empty.
  - `shipping`: Shipping information for the customer, currently set to null.
  - `tax_exempt` : Information about the customer's tax exempt status. Currently set to "none".

- `isSaveCustomer`: A flag indicating if the application should save the customer data. Set to true.
- `isPrimary`: A flag indicating if this customer should be set as the primary. Set to false.
- `provider`: The name of the payment gateway provider. Currently set to "paypal".

The request body options signify that the raw data is in JSON format.

The endpoint doesn't contain specific header data, which means no additional information is passed in the HTTP header when calling this endpoint.

The body of the request contains raw data in JSON format. Here is the breakdown of each data field in the body:

- "accountId": This field holds the unique identifier of the account associated with the customer. It is expected to be of a string type.
- "sessionId": This field contains the unique identifier of the customer's session. It is also expected to be a string.
- "customerId": Similarly, this field carries the unique identifier of the particular customer whose details are being updated.

The "options" object signifies additional properties like the "raw" field stating that the language of API request data is 'json'. It specifies the actual formatting of the data to be sent in the request. Here the data is sent as raw JSON data.
